articles.title: UFC 321: The greatest heavyweight is‚Ä¶ + Throwing in the towel [FULL SHOW] | Good Guy / Bad Guy
articles.description: On this episode of Good Guy / Bad Guy‚Ä¶Will UFC 321 decide who the greatest heavyweight is when Tom Aspinall puts his title on the line against Ciryl Gane? Or will another name be making headlines when it‚Äôs all said and done? You do not want to miss what the guys think Monday‚Äôs headline will be. Then, the women‚Äôs strawweight belt is up for grabs in the co-main event. And it‚Äôs a rematch five years in the making when Virna Jandiroba takes on Mackenzie Dern. But does their first fight even matter once that Octagon door closes? Plus, to throw in the towel or not throw in the towel? That is the question when it comes to Reiner de Ridder and the decision to save him from being mauled by Brendan Allen in the fifth round last week in Vancouver. Find out if the Good Guy or Bad Guy believe it was the right decision and if it changes RDR‚Äôs aura moving forward. #ESPN #MMA #UFC ‚úî For more UFC, sign up for ESPN+ http://espnplus.com/ufc/youtube ‚úî Get the ESPN App: http://www.espn.com/espn/apps/espn ‚úî Subscribe to ESPN on YouTube: http://es.pn/SUBSCRIBEtoYOUTUBE ‚úî Subscribe to ESPN FC on YouTube: http://bit.ly/SUBSCRIBEtoESPNFC ‚úî Subscribe to NBA on ESPN on YouTube: http://bit.ly/SUBSCRIBEtoNBAonESPN ‚úî Watch ESPN on YouTube TV: http://es.pn/YouTubeTV

articles.title: UFC 321 packs PRESSURE, UFC Vancouver delivers SHOCKER, more overreactions | ORT
articles.description: "Overreaction Time" (Tuesdays, noon ET) is a weekly podcast hosted by MMA Junkie managing editor Simon Samano where he shares his "overreactions" with an MMA Junkie staff member, and the debate begins! On this edition, he and MMA Junkie reporter Danny Segura discuss the following: (00:00) - Intro (01:19) - We overestimated Reinier de Ridder, and his loss to Brendan Allen proved that he isn‚Äôt UFC champion material. (06:31) - UFC 321: Anything other than a dominant performance from Tom Aspinall would be disappointing. (11:13) - UFC 321: If Mackenzie Dern doesn‚Äôt win this vacant title, she‚Äôll officially be considered a bust. (15:58) - UFC 321: Nobody has more pressure to win than Umar Nurmagomedov. (21:45) - Khamzat Chimaev doesn't deserve to challenge Alex Pereira for the light heavyweight title. (24:28) - Sean Brady got screwed over by the UFC. Be sure to subscribe to receive updates when we post new content: https://www.youtube.com/@MMAJunkieOfficial?sub_confirmation=1 For the latest UFC and MMA news: https://mmajunkie.usatoday.com Part of the USA TODAY network: http://www.usatoday.com #mma #ufc #ufc321 #ufcvancouver #tomaspinall #khamzatchimaev

articles.title: What Went Wrong for Reinier de Ridder?
articles.description: Reinier de Ridder faced Brendan Allen in a UFC showdown, but things didn‚Äôt go as planned. Chael Sonnen breaks down what went wrong for RDR, the key moments that shifted the fight, and how his corner handled the pressure. From strategy mistakes to mental challenges, Chael dives into the lessons every fighter ‚Äî and fan ‚Äî should understand. He also talks about why it‚Äôs important to wait and see how the UFC heavyweight division develops, especially with the upcoming Gane vs Aspinall fight, and why the direction of the middleweight division matters before making predictions or assumptions about fighters‚Äô next steps. Discussion:Do you think RDR made the right choices in the Octagon, or could he have handled things differently? And how do you see the UFC heavyweight and middleweight divisions shaping up after these fights? articles.title: Kevin Holland Should NOT Have Continued After Groin Strike‚Ä¶
articles.description: Kevin Holland faced a tough moment in the Octagon, and many are questioning whether he should have kept going. Chael Sonnen breaks down the fight, analyzing the critical moments where continuing may have put Holland at risk, and what this means for his career moving forward. In This Video: * Kevin Holland‚Äôs key fight moments * The risks of pushing through in the Octagon * Mental vs. physical readiness for MMA fights * How this impacts Holland‚Äôs legacy and next steps * Chael‚Äôs advice for fighters in high-stakes situations Discussion:Did Kevin Holland make the right call, or should he have stopped earlier? articles.title: Chael Reacts to Reinier de Ridder Quitting on his Stool‚Ä¶
articles.description: Reinier de Ridder shocked the MMA world when he chose not to continue ‚Äî quitting on his stool mid-fight. But was it really quitting‚Ä¶ or something deeper? Chael Sonnen breaks down what really happened, the mindset of a fighter in that moment, and why the conversation around ‚Äúquitting‚Äù might not be as simple as fans think. Chael gives his honest reaction to the fight, the UFC Middleweight division and talks about what separates fighters between 3 and 5 round fights, and shares his take on how this moment could define Reinier de Ridder‚Äôs career moving forward.
